divs: sighting detailstime: approx. 11:10 pm est place: shermans dale, pa. approx. 15 mi. wnw from harrisburg, pa. approx. 25 mi. wnw from harrisburg international airport. weather: partially overcast from an afternoon t-storm observed: object traveling abnormally fast, altitude of normal flight path to harrisburg international airport, direction intersecting normal flight path, movement erratic and luminosity with low rapid emission. nothing spectacular but abnormal. i was in the driveway of my home getting air and looking at stars, airplanes and lightning bugs flying about before going to bed. the location is in a normal landing approach from the wnw to harrisburg international airport. planes normally come from nw to se then turn e to the airport runway after clearing a mountain. what caught my attention was this object (coming from wnw), appearing at approach altitude harrisburg international, but at excessive speed and off nw approach. normally approaching planes have their marker light flashing methodically and when off reappear in the direction of their trajectory. as this object traveled the light appeared to intermittently displace itself from its normal trajectory. at first, at distance, i thought the object was a plane slightly off path, and lights perhaps obscured by overcast clouds. the object (only lights visible) was coming in my direction from the wnw to pass south of me. it appeared to cross the approach path to harrisburg international at near the approach altitude. the speed was faster than normal approaches and as the object began to disappear behind a large tree, i walked quickly some 100 feet down the road to keep it in sight. what could be described as the white marker light was blinking abnormally fast with low emission. the light intermittently appeared behind then above normal trajectory. in the final moments observed the light appeared as 2 objects, with 1 substantially higher than the other, (an impossibility at the apparent distance and altitude). the total observed duration was approx. 20-30 seconds, terminating in the object suddenly disappearing either behind cloud cover or otherwise. after it disappeared, i called my son (whose eye are better) to come out for a chance reappearance (no reappearance). i stayed out (watchful) for about 90 minutes more and saw only planes and a few shooting stars. lots of lightning bugs. feelings: i wished for a closer and longer observation. it instilled no fear or emotion (guessing distance at a mile or so), other than the liking something more conclusive. pictures\videos: sorry, none. i was on my way to bed. after the appearance of 2 simultaneous objects then disappearance i knew planes can't do that. i've been on 2 aircraft carriers, watched lots of take-offs, landings and maneuvers. this didn't fit.
Summary: Object appeared at flight approach path altitude at off angle, higher rate of speed. Marker lights blinking fast, odd pattern, low emission, split to 2 then disappeared.
